item.title: Blade Ball Thanksgiving Event Ushers in the Holidays With Festive Quests and Activities
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/blade-ball-thanksgiving-event-ushers-in-the-holidays-with-festive-quests-and-activities

Roblox’s stylish dodgeball minigame, Blade Ball, is cutting into Thanksgiving 2024 with a brand-new Thanksgiving Event that adds holiday-themed activities for players to feast on.

The festive event arrived alongside a stuffed V6.4 update that originally made its way to players last weekend. Although the event itself kicked off a few days ago, there’s never been a better time to dive in and see what turkey-themed activities there are to enjoy.

Roblox Blade Ball players can access the Thanksgiving Event themselves by keeping an eye out for the turkey NPC in the lobby. Those who manage to spot a turkey in their games can be granted Turkey Coins and unlock unique rewards. It’s an event filled with distractions to keep competitors busy with additional quests, daily rewards, a shop, and more.

V6.4 also introduces a few other changes to keep players bouncing back. Crown Clash, for example, is a game mode that can be voted for every five rounds and sees players trying to survive while carrying a crown for as long as possible. Win Streaks are another addition that will allow users to show off their win streak with a counter above their heads. Of course, developer Wiggity also introduced a few bug fixes and balance adjustments, including nerfs for Dragon Spirit and Phantom.

The Blade Ball Thanksgiving Event started on November 23 and runs for two weeks. That means you’ve only got until December 7 to enjoy everything it has to offer. If you plan on using your Thanksgiving break to finally check out how the team at Wiggity celebrates the holidays, you can see our list of all active Blade Ball codes here to help set yourself up. You can also check out everything included in the Thanksgiving Event by reading the full V6.4 patch notes below.

Blade Ball V6.4 Patch Notes

Thanksgiving Event

- Locate the Turkey NPC in the lobby to access this event, but be warned - it only lasts 2 weeks!

- Keep an eye out for a random Turkey running in your game! It will grant you Turkey Coins.

- Daily Rewards

- Shop

- Quests

- Turkey Feast: contribute your coins to reach milestones and unlock rewards!

Crown Clash

- Vote for this gamemode every 5 rounds!

- Once a player is selected, they will have a crown icon with a stopwatch over their head. Survive with the crown for as long as possible to win!

- Use your Crowns to unlock the Reward Crate

Win Streak

- Winning a game will give you a win streak above your head!

- *Only counts in servers with >4 players

- *Only counts in normal lobbies: not duels, LTM's, or ranked.

New Coin Ability [Golden Ball!]

- (PASSIVE) Continue your destruction! The ball will not respawn after eliminating an enemy.

- [UPG1] Upon elimination, the ball will temporarily speed up 15%

Dragon Spirit x Phantom Nerf

- Dragon Spirit: now 4 seconds per dragon.

- Phantom: ball now takes 500ms before moving.

2 Balls

- 2 balls is now a permanent votable gamemode.

Bug Fixes

33 Swords

21 Explosions

17 Emotes

Michael Cripe is a freelance contributor with IGN. He started writing in the industry in 2017 and is best known for his work at outlets such as The Pitch, The Escapist, OnlySP, and Gameranx.

Be sure to give him a follow on Twitter @MikeCripe.

item.title: Rivals Update 7 Patch Notes Outline Plans for Weekly Weapon Drops
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/rivals-update-7-patch-notes-outline-plans-for-weekly-weapon-drops

Nosniy Games's Roblox FPS is ending 2024 with a bang.

Popular Roblox first-person shooter multiplayer experience Rivals just unloaded Update 7 – The Massive Weapons Update, setting players up to receive a laundry list of new guns to battle with in the coming weeks.

The latest in a line of updates hones in on weapon variety, adding three new weapons – an Energy Rifle, Energy Pistols, and a Crossbow – to use against opponents starting today. It’s a Thanksgiving smorgasbord that will only continue to pile on, as new weapons are scheduled to be added every week for the next month and a half. It means players can come back to find new tools to play with all the way into early 2025, with the final weapon set to drop in mid-January.

While details on the next seven firearms remain a mystery, developer Nosniy Games made sure to include even more changes in Update 7. Players will find a new Energy Bundle in the shop, for example, with three new Wraps and six new Charms now available to obtain when completing specific challenges. Rivals fans will also find that the team has tweaked the Flamethrower, Revolver, Slingshot, and Grenade weapons to help make the overall experience more balanced.

In addition to various bug fixes and map changes, Nosniy promises to unveil even more content with a Winter update that is set to arrive in “just a few weeks.” The Massive Weapons Update patch notes also touch on the long-awaited Ranked Mode, saying that it has “evolved” and is now set to arrive as part of a larger update sometime in early 2025.

“We want to make sure Ranked is an amazing experience on release,” Nosniy explains, “but we've been backed up with these necessary holiday updates. We thank you all for understanding, it'll be worth the wait!”

Roblox players can look forward to more Rivals updates before and after 2024 comes to a close. While we wait to see what weapons await us, you can check out all active Rivals codes here. You can also read up on the time IKEA offered to pay players to serve meatballs in its virtual Roblox store.

Finally, you can see the full patch notes for Update 7 below.

  • ﻿﻿Fixed a bug where certain fire particles would obstruct vision
  • ﻿﻿Fixed a bug where breaking windows/targets/other objects played finisher effects
  • ﻿﻿Fixed a rare bug where some weapons would incorrectly display as MAX level
  • ﻿﻿Fixed a rare bug that softlocked players that quick attacked right before being frozen
  • ﻿﻿Fixed a rare bug that allowed you to run really fast

A NOTE FROM THE DEVELOPERS

  • ﻿﻿Hey everyone, we hope you enjoy these next few weeks as we release a ton of brand new weapons for the first time in months!
  • ﻿﻿To be further transparent, our next update is planned to be the Winter/Festive update coming out in just a few weeks!
  • ﻿﻿Our plan for the highly anticipated Ranked mode has evolved into a much bigger update, which we now plan to release at the beginning of the new year.
  • ﻿﻿We want to make sure Ranked is an amazing experience on release, but we've been backed up with these necessary holiday updates. We thank you all for understanding, it'll be worth the wait!

item.title: Palworld X Terraria Coming in 2025, December Update Set to Add Huge New Island
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/palworld-x-terraria-coming-in-2025-december-update-set-to-add-huge-new-island

Palworld developer Pocketpair has teased a major update for the game coming in December as well as a crossover with Terraria.

Taking to the Palworld Discord, Pocketpair said the December update adds the “largest, harshest, and most mysterious” island yet to Palworld. This new island is about six times bigger than Sakurajima, which hit Palworld in June.

“Don't miss it!” Pocketpair teased alongisde the screenshots, below.

Palworld December 2024 Update Screenshots

Meanwhile, Pocketpair teased a surprise crossover with indie smash hit Terraria. There are no details yet, but artwork, below, shows characters from both games clasping hands. Expect whatever this is to arrive in 2025.

All this comes, of course, as Pocketpair works to defend itself in a high-profile patent lawsuit filed by Nintendo and The Pokémon Company. After Palworld’s huge launch earlier this year on PC and Xbox, comparisons were made between Palworld’s Pals and Pokémon, with some accusing Pocketpair of "ripping off" Pokémon designs. But rather than file a copyright infringement lawsuit, Nintendo and The Pokémon Company have gone down the patent route. They want 5 million yen (approx $32,846) each plus late payment damages, as well as an injunction against Palworld that would block its release.

Earlier this month, Pocketpair confirmed the three Japan-based patents, which revolve around catching Pokémon in a virtual field, that it's being sued over. Palworld does include a mechanic that involves throwing a ball-like object (called a Pal Sphere) at monsters out in a field to capture them, similar to the mechanic seen in the 2022 Nintendo Switch exclusive Pokémon Legends: Arceus. One of the three patents in question is about riding on top of Pokémon (Palworld also lets players ride Pals).

One patent expert has suggested a GTA 5 mod dating back to 2016 may be recognized as a precedent by the court because it included the catching Pokémon mechanic long before Pokémon Legends: Arceus. If that happens, it could work in Palworld’s favor.

Palworld launched on Steam priced $30 and straight into Game Pass on Xbox and PC earlier this year, breaking sales and concurrent player number records in the process. Pocketpair boss Takuro Mizobe has said Palworld's launch was so big that the developer couldn’t handle the massive profits the game generated. Still, Pocketpair acted swiftly to capitalize on Palworld’s breakout success, signing a deal with Sony to form a new business called Palworld Entertainment that’s tasked with expanding the IP.

Patent experts have said Nintendo and The Pokémon Company’s lawsuit against Pocketpair is evidence of the threat posed by Palworld, which has since gone on to launch on PS5. Pocketpair has vowed to take on Nintendo and The Pokémon Company in court, saying: “We will continue to assert our position in this case through future legal proceedings.”

Wesley is the UK News Editor for IGN. Find him on Twitter at @wyp100. You can reach Wesley at wesley_yinpoole@ign.com or confidentially at wyp100@proton.me.

item.title: The Best Buy Black Friday Sale Starts Now: The Best Deals on PlayStation 5, Gaming PCs, Laptops, and TVs
item.content:encoded:
https://www.ign.com/articles/best-buy-black-friday-sales-2024

The Best Buy Black Friday Sale has officially started! All of the best console deals can be found here, including the PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, Asus ROG Ally X, and the Meta Quest 3S. Best Buy also has the best pricing on several video games, including Metaphor: Refantazio, Sonic X Shadow Generations, and Warhammer 40,000K: Space Marine 2.

One category where Best Buy seems to really shine are its selection of gaming laptops and gaming PCs. The sheer number and quality of the deals outclasses the ones we found on Amazon, Walmart, or Target so far.

A big advantage you get for shopping at Best Buy over online-only retailers like Amazon is that you have the option of buying online and picking it up in store. Chances are there's a retail location within driving distance of your home. Not only do you avoid the hassle of shipping, especially during the busy holiday season, but returning your order can be a lot easier, especially on larger items like computers and TVs.

Sony PlayStation 5 Slim Disc Console Fortnite Cobalt Star Console Bundle

Sony released their entire set of Black Friday PlayStation deals last week and most major retailers have followed suit. The best deal is definitely on the consoles themselves: the PS5 Slim Disc Edition has dropped to $424.99 (originally $500) and the PS5 Slim Digital Edition has dropped to $374.99 (originally $450). I would choose the Disc Edition because it's only $50 more and then I have the option to buy (and later sell or trade) physical disc media. But if you want to save some money and go the Digital Edition route, I would suggest getting the NBA 2K25 bundle, which also includes a game. Although the Fortnite Cobalt Star bundle has a fancy looking box, no actual game is included.

More Playstation Black Friday Deals

Metaphor: ReFantazio

Metaphor: ReFantazio was released on October 11, so it's nice to see a nice 29% off discount so soon after launch. This is an outstanding RPG that gets pretty much everything right: intensely enjoyable combat, a gripping epic storyline, and hyper-stylized graphics. I've beaten the game, and I think it's just as good as Persona 5 (which I also loved). In his 9/10 IGN review, Michael Higham wrote that "Refining the Atlus RPG formula of weaving tough turn-based combat into compelling social sim mechanics, Metaphor: ReFantazio doesn’t just send a powerful message across its political drama, it becomes a beautiful expression of the real impact storytelling can have on all of us."

More Black Friday Video Game Deals for PS5/Xbox

CyberPowerPC Gamer Supreme AMD Ryzen 7 7800X3D RTX 4070 Super Gaming PC

This CyberPowerPC is actually one of the best Black Friday gaming PC deals across all retailers. It's equipped with an AMD Ryzen 7 7800X3D CPU (considered by many to be the best gaming CPU before the new Ryzen 7 9800X3D came along earlier this month), and the RTX 4070 Super GPU. The RTX 4070 Super is the best GPU for most people and it's an awesome card for both 1080p and 1440p gaming. In our RTX 4070 Super review, Jacqueline Thomas wrote that "The Nvidia GeForce RTX 4070 Super is the mid-range card we should have got back when the RTX 4000 generation launched. It's around 16% faster in most games at the same price. If you've been waiting to make your GPU upgrade, now's the time."

More Black Friday Gaming PC Deals

For more deals, check out our best Black Friday gaming PC deals roundup. If you want to purchase a gaming PC directly from a manufacturer, check out the Dell Early Black Friday Sale and the HP Early Black Friday Sale. These computers are made-to-order and usually take longer to ship out, but the consistency in build quality makes them worth it.

Lenovo LOQ 15" AMD Ryzen 7 7435HS RTX 4060 Gaming Laptop

Right now you can get a Lenovo LOQ RTX 4060 gaming laptop for only $699.99. That's the least expensive RTX 4060 laptop deal we've seen so far for Black Friday. The LOQ is Lenovo's lineup of budget-oriented gaming laptops. This model features a 15" 1080p display, a low-voltage AMD Ryzen 7 7435HS CPU, GeForce RTX 4060 GPU, 16GB of RAM, and a 512GB SSD. The RTX 4060 has the maximum TGP that can supplied to an RTX 4060 mobile GPU (115W). That means it will perform near the top of its class, and even beat out some RTX 4070 gaming laptops.

More Black Friday Gaming Laptop Deals

For more deals, check out our best Black Friday gaming laptop deals roundup.

Asus ROG Ally X AMD Ryzen Z1 Extreme 1TB Gaming Handheld

Best Buy is the only retailer to drop the price on the new Asus ROG Ally X so far for Black Friday, Right now you can get it for $699.99 after a $100 instant discount. In our Asus ROG Ally X review, gaming guru Jacqueline Thomas wrote that "the Asus ROG Ally X is simply the best handheld gaming PC on the market right now. With more and faster memory and double the battery as the original Ally, the Ally X will run any modern game without dying in an hour and a half."

The Asus ROG Ally X improves on the original ROG Ally in several ways, the biggest upgrades being a much bigger 80Whr battery with nearly the runtime, more RAM, a beefier cooling system, double the storage capacity on the base model, and better controls. It's not inexpensive starting at $799.99 $699.99, but it's definitely an incredible piece of hardware.

More Black Friday PC Gaming Deals

Nintendo Switch Mario Kart 8 Deluxe Bundle

Compared to the PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X, the Nintendo Switch console has the best discount for Black Friday. The holiday bundles, which were released back in October, included your choice of the Switch or Switch OLED, a digital download voucher for Mario Kart 8 Deluxe, and a 12-month Switch Online membership. I thought that this was going to be the official Black Friday deal. Alas, Best Buy (but not Amazon, due to their supposedly shaky relationship) has just knocked another $75 off the price tag. That means you can pick up a Switch bundle for as low as $225.

More Black Friday Switch Deals

Sonic X Shadow Generations

IGN absolutely loves this video game. In our 9/10 Sonic X Shadow Generations review, Jada Griffin wrote that "Sonic X Shadow Generations takes an already excellent game and spring jumps it to new heights with a creative Shadow campaign and an appreciable graphical upgrade." This game is actually a collection of two games in one: a remaster of the 2011 Sonic Generations and - the highlight - a brand new, original campaign starring Shadow the Hedgehog.

More Black Friday Video Game Deals for Switch

Best Buy isn't the only retailer with games already on sale. For more deals on video games sorted by individual platform, check out our best Black Friday deal guides for PlayStation 5, Nintendo Switch, and Xbox Series X.

More Black Friday TV Deals

More Black Friday Xbox Deals

Apple AirPods Pro 2

One of the best Apple Black Friday deals has arrived and it's better than I predicted. Best Buy has dropped the price of the second-generation Apple AirPods Pro wireless noise-canceling earbuds to $159.99. This discount brings the price down to the same level as the Apple AirPods 4 with noise cancellation. Between the two, the AirPods Pro is still Apple's best earbuds because it offers better sound quality and better noise cancellation performance.

Sonos Arc

The Arc is Sonos' flagship product. We rated it the best soundbar of 2024. This is a premium soundbar and it shows. This 45" soundbar houses 11 precisely engineered internal speakers, including two dedicated height channels. It's Dolby Atmos ready, and there's enough power here that you can probably get away without a subwoofer. However, the Sonos Arc can be wirelessly paired up with other Sonos speakers and subs to add even more sound distribution. The Arc also has a built-in microphone for voice control so it is Alexa and Google Assistant compatible.

More Black Friday Sonos Deals

When Is Black Friday 2024?

We’re in the home stretch: Black Friday falls on November 29 this year. All month long, retailers have been rolling out sales, ramping up to massive discounts on Black Friday and through the weekend into Cyber Monday. There are already some fantastic deals available on PS5 consoles and controllers, video games for all platforms, AirPods Pro, and tons more.

Eric Song is the IGN commerce manager in charge of finding the best gaming and tech deals every day. When Eric isn't hunting for deals for other people at work, he's hunting for deals for himself during his free time.
